title: Daily Market Digest: February 16, 2026
subtitle: A professional overview of today's market activities. Not financial advice.

items.headline: Global Markets Show Mixed Sentiment on Presidents' Day
items.summary: U.S. equity markets are closed today for the Presidents' Day holiday, though futures edged higher in subdued trading. Overall market sentiment remains mixed, influenced by cooling inflation data which offers hope for Federal Reserve rate cuts, yet tempered by persistent concerns over AI disruption across various sectors. Indian markets, however, saw a strong rebound, with key indices closing nearly 1% higher, driven by financials and energy stocks. Global trading volumes are generally thin due to multiple Asian markets being closed for Lunar New Year.

items.headline: AppLovin ($APP)
items.summary: Technology company AppLovin rose, recovering some losses.

items.headline: Engineers India
items.summary: Surged following strong December quarter performance.

items.headline: Nvidia ($NVDA)
items.summary: Computer chipmaker and heaviest weight on S&P 500, continued its decline.

items.headline: Brainbees Solutions
items.summary: Fell sharply due to investor disappointment with December quarter numbers.

items.headline: AI Concerns Drive Rotation in U.S. Sectors
items.summary: Artificial intelligence disruption continues to weigh on US equity markets, with selling pressure spreading from software to real estate, trucking, and financial services last week. This has led to a rotation of capital from high-multiple software names into 'Real Economy' sectors like Industrials ($XLI), Energy ($XLE), and Materials ($XLB), which are currently leading. Consumer Staples ($XLP) also appears to be a rising star. Technology ($XLK), Communication Services ($XLC), and Financials ($XLF) continue to underperform.

items.headline: Indian Sectors See Strong Performance
items.summary: In India, Nifty Realty emerged as the top-performing sector with a 1.60% rally, followed by Nifty PSU Bank, Nifty Pharma, Nifty Oil & Gas, and Nifty FMCG, all surging between 0.80% and 1%. Financials and pharma stocks were key drivers of the market recovery. Conversely, Nifty Media slipped 0.90% and Nifty Auto fell 0.73%.

items.headline: Cooling Inflation Fuels Fed Rate Cut Hopes
items.summary: A report last week indicated that U.S. inflation cooled last month, with the Consumer Price Index (CPI) rising 2.4% year-over-year, down from 2.7% in December. This data, softer than expected, has bolstered hopes for a Federal Reserve interest rate cut later in the year, although core inflation remains a concern. Investors are keenly awaiting the upcoming FOMC minutes for further cues on the Fed's policy path.

items.headline: Key Earnings Reports and Economic Data This Week
items.summary: While U.S. markets observe Presidents' Day, companies like Ansell Limited, HUB24 Limited, Antofagasta plc, ReNew Energy Global, Armada Hoffler Properties, and Otter Tail have earnings scheduled for today. The week ahead will also see reports from major companies including Walmart, Warner Bros. Discovery, Booking Holdings, Deere & Company, and Palo Alto Networks, which will be crucial for directional cues.

items.headline: Macro Trends: Oil, Gold, and Global Economy
items.summary: Lower U.S. bond yields are generally supportive of market sentiment. Crude oil prices are broadly steady ahead of a second round of talks between the U.S. and Iran this week. Gold prices have moved above $5,000 an ounce, finding support from the weaker-than-expected U.S. inflation data. Meanwhile, Japan's economy showed slower-than-expected growth in the October-December quarter, expanding at an annualized 0.2%.
